intro: Acourtia nudiuscula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved acourtia, is a low-growing perennial plant native to California and Baja California. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers in clusters, typically blooming from spring to early summer. Acourtia nudiuscula thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal scrub habitats. It is an important species for local pollinators and is considered a rare and endangered plant in some areas.
